item.title: Tanya add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "If any man wish to write in a clear style, let him be first clear in his thoughts; and if any would write in a noble style, let him first possess a noble soul." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Tanya add a quote by Robert M. Hutchins
item.description: "Football, fraternities, and fun have no place in the university. They were introduced only to entertain those who shouldn’t be in the university." -- Robert M. Hutchins

item.title: Tanya add a quote by Andrew Lang
item.description: "Young men, especially in America, write to me and ask me to recommend “a course of reading.” Distrust a course of reading! People who really care for books read all of them. There is no other course." -- Andrew Lang

item.title: Tanya add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Tanya add a quote by Robert Maynard Hutchins
item.description: "The death of democracy is not likely to be an assassination from ambush. It will be a slow extinction from apathy, indifference, and undernourishment." -- Robert Maynard Hutchins

item.title: Tanya add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I had a terrible education. I attended a school for emotionally disturbed teachers." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Tanya add a quote by Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: "The day obedience becomes a quest and not an irritation is the day you gain power." -- Spencer W. Kimball

item.title: Tanya add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tanya add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
